results.title: Billabong
results.brief_description: Set among the red gums, this film captures the mood of one day on the Murray River, Echuca, Victoria. Shows where thousands of birds come to breed each year.

results.brief_description: Gymnastic youngsters bound through a regime of physical health and fitness. An instructional film promoting an ideal of rigorous physical culture demonstrating a number of acrobatic manouvers.

results.title: Film work
results.creator_credit: John Hughes and Waterside Workers' Federation of Australia. Film Unit.
results.brief_description: This film recalls the work of the Waterside Workers’ Federation Film Unit. Financed by several trade unions, the Unit produced eleven (mainly documentary) films between 1953-58. There are excerpts from four of the films ‘Pensions for Veterans’, ‘The Hungry Miles’, ‘November Victory’ and ‘Hewers of Coal’ and interviews with the Unit members, Keith Gow, Norma Disher and Jock Levy. (Awards: ATOM 1982)

results.title: Experiments in three colour separation
results.brief_description: A documentary of the work of Arthur and Corinne Cantrill since 1975 in 3-colour separation. Discusses the classic theories and principles in 3-colour separation in film and photography. Commentary by Arthur Cantrill.

results.title: Tucker
results.brief_description: Highlights the importance of good food habits. The importance of early experiences is emphasized, together with the valuable role of the school canteen and the teachers who promote good eating habits using the basic five food groups.

results.title: Aboriginal canoe trees of the Murray
results.creator_credit: Robert Edwards, South Australian Museum and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
results.brief_description: Aborigines of the lower Murray River formerly made large canoes from the bark of Red Gum trees. This film documents the felling of a canoe tree from the sides of the Murray and its transportation to the South Australian Museum for preservation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Edwards, South Australian Museum and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies

results.title: Learning English : it's harder than you think (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Premier's Dept. Ethnic Affairs Division and Panorama Productions
results.brief_description: An Australian looks at the problems faced by migrants in learning to speak English. Through his investigation we learn that they face many problems: pressures of finding work as soon as they arrive, difficulties in finding classes that don’t conflict with work hours, working in jobs where there is little communication with others. Isolation restricts their practice of language

results.title: The Cubbies
results.creator_credit: David Woodgate, Ron Saunders and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Features an adventure playground which allows children to play on their own terms, and enables creative expression. Through the eyes of Joan Healy, Supervisor of the Fitzroy Adventure Playground (South Australia), the film takes a candid look at the children and their projects.

results.title: November = Novembre
results.creator_credit: Robert Nichol, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A hundred and one lingering, luminous impressions of the month when the ripe fullness of the Canadian autumn wilts and the whole earth seems to settle into brooding calm. This is a cine-poem, reflecting the somber moods of November, the still, waiting separateness when the Canadian year dawdles, hangs back from the hour when the first snowfall will make all things even. But from the muted tones of the dying season emerges a new, stark beauty. Film without words. (Contains images of duck hunting and animial skinning that may offend some viewers.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Nichol, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: For the love of a child
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: This film explores and examines natural childbirth and how it is being accepted. The film shows a Childbirth Education Class at work. These classes are teaching women to understand and control what is happening to their bodies during childbirth, and it involves fathers to be.
